de.affect.tools

Class AffectApplet

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Panel
          • java.applet.Applet
            • de.affect.tools.AffectApplet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AffectUpdateListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class AffectApplet
extends java.applet.Applet
implements AffectUpdateListener
    The affect applet encapsulates an instance of the affect manager.
    Author:
    Gernot Gebhard, 2005 (based on the conceptual work of Patrick Gebhard)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setDisplay

        public void setDisplay(java.lang.String characters,
              boolean emotion,
              boolean def,
              boolean mood,
              boolean tendency,
              boolean query)
        Set list of available characters. The applet knows which characters are available but does not know which should be displayed. This function is called by javascript and thus is also included in the critical section.
        Parameters:
        characters - A ',' separated list of characters.
        emotion - Dominant Emotion should be displayed?
        def - Show default mood?
        mood - Mood should be displayed?
        tendency - Mood tendency should be displayed?
        query - User query enabled?

      • setDialog

        public void setDialog(java.lang.String file)
        Set the dialog contents by extracting the context information out of the given script file respectively displaying an ordinary html file This will additonally load the associated script.
        Parameters:
        file - The name of the script file.
